intro: Trichodesma calathiforme, commonly known as the umbrella flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its unique, umbrella-like inflorescence composed of numerous small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces a distinctive, sweet-smelling fragrance. Trichodesma calathiforme is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
